channel.title: Wanju-gun on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: It is more delicious if you know and drink! Korea Sulthema Museum - Wanju-gun, Jeollabuk-do, Korea
item.description:
Impressive exhibits at the Korea Sulma Museum

It is more delicious if you know and drink! Korea Sulthema Museum

Wanju-gun, Jeollabuk-do, Korea

It is the end of the year when you drink more alcohol than usual. Some may like it, and some may not be able to afford it. Alcoholic beverages entertain people and comfort their minds, but sometimes they become poison and harm their health and relationships. For sake
Full-scale exhibitions are gathered in the first and second exhibition halls on the third floor. The 1st Exhibition Hall's chief artifact exhibition hall displays a selection of 50,000 artifacts that fit the theme. The old days used to make alcohol
The Korea Sulma Theme Museum opened in October 2015
The huge wooden pavilion in the middle of the exhibition hall is a mix of godubap or yeast when making cheonju or takju. There are plenty of things to see, such as the alcoholic beverages that were numbered to collect taxes during the Japanese colonial rule, and the alcoholic beverages that were used to carry alcohol.
It is full of valuable artifacts, centered on giant ships.
In the three-dimensional video theater next to the Sujanghyeong Artifacts Exhibition, you can watch the video of the story of Haemosu, who went to get the most delicious sake from the world to get the oil painting of Habaek, the daughter of the god of water, who loved drinking.
Early domestic wine
The Joseon Dynasty period was the dark age of alcohol
The second exhibition hall has an impressive entrance like a suldog. There are many interesting contents, including how to make sake based on ingredients, and the streets that reproduce the history and culture of Korean sake, traditional sake, and taverns of memories. During the Joseon Dynasty, this was often done to save grain. Alcohol was forbidden when there was a condition or severe drought caused a bad year. Yeongjo was especially strict with alcohol. It is said that Danjong (Gamju) was used instead during the rite of Jongmyo Shrine, and was ruled to be a death penalty when violating Geumjuryeong.
World alcohol and unique wine bottles
The street of memories that reproduced the tavern in the 1970s and 1990s actually reproduced the ompan house and Yongjin foundry in Jeonju. Thanks to the creation of food and people models in alleyways, street lamps, shops, chicken houses, hop houses, and stalls, memories are revived as if they were back in that time on a time machine. A museum specializing in alcohol is not only for adults. Children also have a lot of fun and fun to experience.
Ompanjip, a famous spot in Jeonju in the 1970s
The Hyangeum Culture Experience Hall, located at the innermost of the second exhibition hall, is a space for children. With the Chroma Key technique, when the spectator takes off his shoes and sits in front of the sake table prepared in front of the blue screen, the spectator can appear in the pre-recorded video and perform the ritual ritual in person. This is an experience where you can learn our traditions of inviting guests and serving alcohol. There are a variety of Gyeyeongbae experiences designed to keep the glasses full, rolling the main sphere, matching puzzles, and coloring.
Hyangeum Culture Experience Center with many experiences for children
Juryong-gu is a 14-sided dice with penalties written on each side, such as drinking 3 glasses at a time, drinking 1 poem, dancing without a song, and hitting the noses of several people. A glimpse into the drinking culture of the new lines
Juryu-gu with interesting penalties
Various experience programs
Tobacco Culture Planning Exhibition Hall, located next to the elevator on the first floor, is easy to miss. It is a place where tobacco, which can be said to be the best drink, can be seen in one place, from the first cigarettes in Korea to the world's famous cigarettes. Korea-Japan merger
Tobacco Culture Planning Exhibition Hall
Various educational experience programs are held in the basement experience room on the first basement level. It is good to enjoy the making of Juryong-gu, fermentation experience activity, making fermented bread, making cookies, and fermentation healing therapy. Adult programs include making rice wine, making house beer, making wine, and making cocktails. It is conducted when there are more than 5 people.
There are many experiences related to fermentation
Outside the building, there is a tasting room where you can taste sake for free. Around 10 kinds of alcohol are prepared, including wine and sake, which represent the region. Up to 3 drinks per person are possible.
Tasting room where you can taste sake for free
It introduces local sake that has been recognized for taste, and suspicious sake at national conventions. I don't have to worry about it because it's a small, one-size-sized cup of thumb.
Enjoy local sake and famous sake
Jeonbuk Provincial Museum of Art with the nest of art at the foot of Moaksan Mountain
When you arrive at the foot of the mountain to climb Moak Mountain, the cover of Jeonbuk Provincial Museum of Art comes before the cover of Moak Mountain. Moaksan was built behind his back, and the grilled reservoir was wrapped like a skirt, so the scenery was outstanding. It wasn't located in the city center, but it was a museum that nested in nature, so it wasn't because there were few visitors and it was cool. Oh, Mt.
Jeonbuk Provincial Museum of Art
On weekends, experience programs for children are held. Programs such as making and decorating are conducted free of charge, and participation is available on a first-come, first-served basis.
Inside a spacious and cool structure
Travel information

Korea Sulthema Museum
-Address: 232-58, Deokcheonjeon-gil, Gu-myeon, Wanju-gun, Jeollabuk-do
-Inquiries: 063-290-3842

http://www.sulmuseum.kr/index.9is

Jeonbuk Provincial Museum
-Address: 111-6, Moaksan-gil, Gumyeon, Wanju-gun, Jeollabuk-do
-Inquiries: 063-290-6888

http://www.jma.go.kr/korean/


Restaurants near
-Happy stop: Local food Korean buffet / 95, Moaksan-gil, Gumyeon, Wanju-gun / 063-253-5761
http://blog.naver.com/wjlocalfood

-Sambaekjip: Bean sprout soup / 22, Jeonju guesthouse 2-gil, Wansan-gu, Jeonju-si / 063-284-2227
http://www.300zip.com/

-Rock Lak Noodle: Noodles / 366 Gyeonpyeon-ro, Deokjin-gu, Jeonju-si / 063-247-0082

http://blog.naver.com/rakrak2015

Rooms
-Moaksan Motel: 104-10, Moaksan-gil, Gumyeon, Wanju-gun / 063-222-2023
-Happy Dream Hanok: 181-21 Bongseoan-gil, Yongjin-myeon, Wanju-gun / 063-247-0050
http://cafe.daum.net/happybongse

-Benikia Jeonju Hansung Hotel: 43-3 Jeonju Guest House 5-gil, Wansan-gu, Jeonju-si / 063-288-0014

item.title: Romantic lights embroidering the autumn night, fox lights in the mountains of Wanju - Wanju-gun, Jeollabuk-do, Korea
item.description:
Fox in the mountains embroidering the autumn night

Romantic lights embroidering the autumn night, fox lights in the mountains of Wanju

Wanju-gun, Jeollabuk-do, Korea

There is a light festival with the theme of the novel The Little Prince. The entire Wanju Hiljo Town nestled in Bongsil Mountain in Bibong-myeon, Wanju-gun, Jeollabuk-do turns into a romantic light festival in the evening. During the day, you can walk through the herb garden and fresh forests, and experience activities such as dirt play for children and Indian tents. Shall we go for a night walk while listening to the story of the fox?
There is no fox in the mountains, no fox.
The fox color appeared in Wanju. Old people said that when they encounter strange lights in a field or in a forest, they say it is a goblin or fox fire.
Come play fox in the mountains
The modern version of the goblin with LED bulbs on trees or sculptures can be enjoyed regardless of the weather because there is no risk of electric shock even in the event of snow or rain.
LED embroidered lights
Thanks to the fox in the novel 《The Little Prince》, the name ‘San Fox in the Mountains’ was added to the light festival that colored the night. It is a setting in which the fox who meets again in the dream of the little prince tells a story about him.
The story of “The Little Prince” is installed all over the place.
That doesn't mean that there are fox or young prince sculptures. The storyboards are installed everywhere with pictures. If you don't pay attention to the story board, you don't have to install any lights. There are also impressive passages from the novel, and advice to cherish this time. There is no fox, but you can enjoy the beautiful fox color by recalling the scene in the novel.
Purple gujeolcho blooming in autumn
Romantic indian tent
The festival hall can be considered as a large garden on a sloping mountain. There is a parking lot at the bottom, and when you climb the stairs, you will see a fox shelter selling ticket counters and snack streets.
Moonlight garden full of flowers and herbs
After passing the entrance with the welcome sign next to the ticket office, the road leads to the letter S, and the Moonlight Garden, Wind Garden, Media Art (Performance Hall), Rose Garden of the Little Prince, Mark Brown Cafe, Foxlight Glamping Site, Stone Tower Square, and Jabau Hwadukgui Restaurant Comes out. It is convenient to go to the top and then slowly descend and watch.
The moonlight garden is lit.
If you visit the fox school next to the ticket office during the day, you can experience various things. The ‘no-litter in and out’ using pottery pottery soil is a space where you can freely crush the earthen dough.
The rose that just lit up
The entrance time is set at 11, 2, and 4, so you can enjoy the experience only by going in time. You must bring your own clothes. If you make a reservation, you can also experience making a craftsman, a mensa game, and making a natural product.
month
The Fox Glamping Site, named Apios Village, has an Indian tent in the form of a cow hat. It is said that the Indian tent in the movie <Dancing with the Wolf> was reproduced and made by hand. It can sleep 4 to 6 people. It cannot be cooked inside, and breakfast and dinner are sold in a package provided by the restaurant.
Afios Village with Indian tent
When the lights come on, the romantic atmosphere is full. Sitting on a chair on the deck and looking down, the lights illuminate the mountain. It is a pity that the smell of the inside does not come off easily due to the structure of the tent.
Sit on a camping chair and enjoy the view
The rose garden where the little prince will fall in love
Beneath the camping grounds is Cafe Brown, where you can relax while drinking coffee and tea. Performances are held every Saturday evening on the stage underneath. The contents of the performance are different every time. Mostly, there are stages for amateur singers and bands active in the region as music performances. Sometimes the surprise proposals of lovers are held before or after the performance. If you are a couple considering a special event, please take courage to apply.
Girls in the rose garden
If you follow the rosy side of the theater, you will see the rose garden. It is a fantastic place with tens of thousands of roses in full bloom. Compared to other light festivals, the overall lighting decoration is rather modest, but thanks to the rose garden here, it is more impressive. Roses are not flowers, but harmony. A wire was connected to the stem to make the buds light up. At first glance, there are quite a few who are trying to break it because it is like a flower. It looks more plausible because it has two buds and a blooming rose. Roses that glow white, yellow, or pink spread out like a carpet and are beautiful.
A rose like a carpet
It looks pretty, but it is difficult to capture the feeling with a cell phone camera. To capture the romantic atmosphere, it is important not to use the flash, but to shoot as steady as possible.
A wind garden with a nice pine tree decoration
Beneath the rose garden is a moonlight garden full of herbs and flowers and a wind garden with colorful lights wrapped around trees. Moonlight Garden is better to see when there is sunlight before it gets dark. Flowers bloom every season, and various kinds of herbs are planted to make them fragrant. Fox lights in the mountains are open all year round, and the summer season (May-October) lights up at 6 PM and can be seen until 12 PM (last admission at 11:00). During the winter season (November-April), lighting is faster by 1 hour, and is available from 5 PM to 12 PM (last admission is 11 PM).
Wind Garden Rose
A bowl of noodles on the way to the light festival
Even if time is early on the way to the fox in the mountains, it is good to eat dinner beforehand. This is because there is only one restaurant in the festival hall and only a few snacks. It is a 15-minute drive from Bongdong-eup to Hiljo Town, so it is perfect to eat at Bongdong. Located on the other side of the Bongdong Nonghyup, “The Three Grandmothers Noodle Collection” is a place that has delighted people with delicious noodles for over 60 years.
Foxbit Shelter's Main Beak
There is only one menu, noodles. This is done by adding noodles to the broth, which has a deep rich taste and a refreshing taste, and sprinkle with red pepper powder on the onion. There is no common Zidane or Cucumber, but the chopsticks are delicious enough to be busy. Quickly empty a bowl and make the soup clean even though it is full of pears. It is very simple to put on top of noodles such as kimchi, kkakdugi, cheonyang pepper, and sweet radish. It is divided into large / medium / small depending on the quantity, and the price is also low at 5,000 won / 4,000 won / 3,500 won each. If you order ‘Medium’ for an adult male or ‘Small’ for a female, it is a quantity that can be left slightly due to the stomach. It's not splendid, but it's not special, but it has many long-standing regulars and a lot of people who come and eat it on purpose.
Three grandmother's noodle shops loved with consistent taste
Travel information

Wanju Hiljo Town
Address: 235-38, Cheonho-ro, Bibong-myeon, Wanju-gun, Jeonbuk
Contact: 1899-5852

http://www.healjo.co.kr/


1.Nearby Restaurants

Three Grandmother Noodle Collection: Noodles / 135 Bongdong-dongseo-ro, Bongdong-eup, Wanju-gun / 063-261-2312
New Charm Float: Slow Food Buffet / 11 Bongdong-dongseo-ro, Bongdong-eup, Wanju-gun / 063-261-4276
Ahara: Vegetarian table setting / 854-7, Gosancheon-ro, Gosan-myeon, Wanju-gun / 063-263-3880

2.Accommodation

Moaksan Motel: 104-10, Moaksan-gil, Gumyeon, Wanju-gun / 063-222-2023
With You Hotel: 105 Bongdong-ro, Bongdong-eup, Wanju-gun / 063-261-8088
Happy Dream Hanok: 181-21 Bongseoan-gil, Yongjin-myeon, Wanju-gun / 063-247-0050

http://cafe.daum.net/happybongse
